meanings.definition: To make someone uncertain or unable to understand something.
meanings.sent2: The complex math problem confuses the students.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie confuses the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden change in behavior confuses her friends.
meanings.sent5: The foreign language confuses me like a maze.

meanings.definition: To mix up or mistake one thing for another.
meanings.sent1: I always confuse the twins because they look alike.
meanings.sent2: Please don't confuse salt with sugar in the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The similar packaging confuses customers at the store.
meanings.sent4: The identical keys on the keychain can easily confuse you.
meanings.sent5: The identical houses in the neighborhood confuse visitors.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel embarrassed or self-conscious.
meanings.sent1: His teasing remarks confuse her in front of others.
meanings.sent2: Public speaking often confuses shy individuals.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected spotlight confuses the shy student.
meanings.sent4: The surprise party plan confuses the birthday girl.
meanings.sent5: The sudden attention confuses the introverted person.
